article.title: Evaporation of planetary atmospheres due to XUV illumination by quasars

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure primarily shows the relationship between:
choices: Galaxy age and black hole mass.
Black hole mass and stellar system size.

multiple_choice_question.text: The vertical lines in this figure represent:
choices: The mass of different types of stars.
The XUV flux at different distances from the black hole.
The mass of atmospheres lost for different planets in our solar system.
The lifetime of stars with different masses.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this figure suggest about the impact of XUV radiation on planetary atmospheres over time?
choices: The impact is constant over time.
The impact is negligible at all times.
The mass lost from a planet\'s atmosphere.
The time it takes for a black hole to double in mass.
The distance between a planet and a black hole for a given XUV fluence.
The probability of a planet being in the habitable zone.
